H0.text: A source of solar power is a term that best describes fossil fuels, which can take millions of years to form underground from decaying plants and animals.

H1.text: A source of electrical power is the term that best describes a fossil fuel, which can take millions of years to form underground from decaying plants and animals.

H2.text: A source of renewable energy is a term that best describes fossil fuels, which can take millions of years to form underground from decaying plants and animals.

H3.text: A source of nonrenewable energy is a fossil fuel that can take millions of years to form underground from decaying plants and animals.

A4.text: fossil fuels are classified as non-renewable resources because they take millions of years to form and known viable reserves are being depleted much faster than new ones are generated.

A5.text: In 2023, 77% of primary energy consumption in the world and over 60% of its electricity supply were from fossil fuels.

A6.text: Natural resources such as coal, petroleum (crude oil) and natural gas take thousands of years to form naturally and cannot be replaced as fast as they are being consumed.

A7.text: The modern-day fossil fuel economy is widely criticized for its lack of renewability, as well as being a contributor to climate change.

A8.text: At present, the main energy source used by humans is non-renewable fossil fuels.

A9.text: The increasing levels of investment and capital from conventional financial actors suggest that sustainable energy has become mainstream and the future of energy production, as non-renewable resources decline.
